meanings.definition: The act of classifying something as secret or confidential to an excessive degree.
meanings.sent1: The overclassification of documents led to unnecessary secrecy within the organization.
meanings.sent2: The government's overclassification of information hindered transparency and accountability.
meanings.sent3: The overclassification of the cookie recipe made it seem like a national security issue.
meanings.sent4: Her overclassification of her personal diary turned it into a mysterious treasure trove.
meanings.sent5: The overclassification of the treasure map added an aura of intrigue and importance.

meanings.definition: The state of being classified as secret or confidential to an excessive degree.
meanings.sent1: The overclassification of the report made it nearly impossible to access important details.
meanings.sent2: Living in a constant state of overclassification can lead to feelings of isolation and distrust.
meanings.sent3: The overclassification of the meeting location turned it into a top-secret mission.
meanings.sent4: The overclassification of her emotions made it challenging for others to understand her.
meanings.sent5: The overclassification of the recipe added an unnecessary layer of mystery and intrigue.
